llength(n) Tcl Built-In Commands llength(n) 





NAME


llength - Count the number of elements in a list






SYNOPSIS


llength list










DESCRIPTION


Treats list as a list and returns a decimal string giving
    the number of elements in it.








EXAMPLES


The result is the number of elements:




% llength {a b c d e}
5
% llength {a b c}
3
% llength {}
0




Elements are not guaranteed to be exactly words in a dictionary
    sense of course, especially when quoting is used:




% llength {a b {c d} e}
4
% llength {a b { } c d e}
6




An empty list is not necessarily an empty string:




% set var { }; puts "[string length $var],[llength $var]"
1,0










SEE
  ALSO


list(n), lappend(n), lindex(n), linsert(n), lsearch(n), lset(n),
    lsort(n), lrange(n), lreplace(n)








KEYWORDS


element, list, length







  

    
    Tcl
